prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Acro explains why he could lift up the bust, but could not look out of the window to know where the victim's head was.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 2
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: A prosecutor in Germany since age 13, she has come to America to defeat me in court.
Character 3
Name: Max
Description: A "fabulous" magician famed for his aerial illusions. Accused of murder.
Character 4
Name: Regina Berry
Description: The idol of the Berry Big Circus and daughter to Russel Berry, the Ringmaster.
Character 5
Name: Russell Berry
Description: The victim and Ringmaster of the Berry Big Circus. Regina Berry's father.
Character 6
Name: Ben
Description: Real Name: Benjamin Woodman. A ventriloquist. Conversing with him is really tiring.
Character 7
Name: Moe
Description: Real Name: Lawrence Curls. The Ringmaster's old friend, a pleasant stooge of a clown.
Character 8
Name: Acro
Description: Real Name: Ken Dingling. A star acrobat currently undergoing rehabilitation.
Character 9
Name: Bat
Description: Real Name: Sean Dingling. Bit on the head six months ago by Léon. Still in a coma.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A picture of the crime scene. [caption] A person is lying face down on a big box in the snow. There are footprints leading to where he is.
Evidence 3
Name: Silk Hat
Description: Made-to-order fedora that is a symbol of Max's fabulousness. Found at the crime scene.
Evidence 4
Name: Max G. Promo Poster
Description: Emblazoned with Max's three famous symbols. A silk hat, cloak and white roses.
Evidence 5
Name: Ringmaster's Papers
Description: Documents related to Max's salary negotiations. He got an enormous raise 1 week ago.
Evidence 6
Name: Circus Map
Description: A map of the Berry Big Circus. The circus is depicted on the left. The ring master’s room and cafeteria are on the northeast of the circus. To the right is the lodging house. Moe is on the first floor and Acro is on the third.
Evidence 7
Name: Broken Bottle
Description: An orange juice bottle that was found broken on the cafeteria floor.
Evidence 8
Name: Trilo Quist
Description: A ventriloquist's puppet. An operatic tenor who doubles as Ben's sidekick.
Evidence 9
Name: Money the Monkey
Description: A monkey who takes care of Acro. Habitually gathers all sorts of shiny objects.
Evidence 10
Name: Ring
Description: A cheap ring with an eerie sparkle. "From T to R" is engraved on it.
Evidence 11
Name: Russell's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10:15 PM. Cause: Blunt force trauma to the back of the head.
Evidence 12
Name: Wooden Box
Description: The victim was hunched over this 20 lb. box. It was locked by a small key.
Evidence 13
Name: Small Seasoning Bottle
Description: Found inside the Wooden Box the victim was hunched over. It contains pepper.
Evidence 14
Name: Grand Prix Photo
Description: Photo of Max's Award Ceremony. Max is standing at the center holding a trophy. Two girls stand to either side. The bust of max is right next to him.
Evidence 15
Name: Max G. Bust
Description: Bronze statue taken from the cafeteria before the crime. It looks rather heavy.
Evidence 16
Name: Note
Description: Posted in the Cafeteria on the day of the crime, then torn. States: "To The Murderer!" Torn by Ringmaster, found in his tailcoat pocket. Reads To The Murderer! You haven't forgotten what happened six months ago, have you? I have conclusive evidence of what took place. Meet at 10:00 PM tonight at the lodging house plaza. Found in Regina's pocket on the morning of crime. Reads To The Murderer! You haven't forgotten what happened six months ago, have you? I have conclusive evidence of what took place. Meet at 10:00 PM tonight at the lodging house plaza. Placed by Acro in Regina's pocket on morning of crime. Reads To The Murderer!

You haven't forgotten what
happened six months ago,
have you? I have conclusive
evidence of what took place.

Meet at 10:00 PM tonight
at the lodging house plaza.

Evidence 17
Name: Stage Costume
Description: A shiny spangled vest. It's not Maya's size at all.
Evidence 18
Name: Léon
Description: The animal show's lion. Shot by the Ringmaster six months ago for biting a performer.
Evidence 19
Name: Scarf
Description: Bat's scarf. Stained with his blood and a small quantity of pepper.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I suppose I could have lifted something the size of that bust.
Person: Acro
Testimony 1
Testimony: I have a strong upper body from working as an acrobat, and only my legs were injured.
Person: Acro
Testimony 2
Testimony: However, lifting the bust and looking out of the window would've been impossible.
Person: Acro
Testimony 3
Testimony: There's no way I could have exerted that kind of force on my lower body.
Person: Acro
Testimony 4
Testimony: That makes it impossible for me to have known the location of the Ringmaster's head.
Person: Acro
Testimony 5
Testimony: Thus it would be unrealistic to drop the bust on him. Don't you think?
Person: Acro

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let me try to work through this. So, the user is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The characters involved here are Acro, who's an acrobat with a lower body injury. The testimonies from Acro say that he could lift the bust because of his upper body strength, but couldn't look out the window to know where the victim's head was, making it impossible to drop the bust accurately.

Looking at the evidence, let's see. There's the Crime Photo (Evidence 2) which shows the victim lying face down on a box with footprints leading there. The autopsy report (11) says the cause was blunt force to the back of the head, which would require knowing where the head was. But Acro claims he couldn't see the head's position from the window. However, there's another piece: the Scarf (Evidence 19) which is Bat's scarf stained with blood and pepper. The pepper connects to the seasoning bottle (13) in the wooden box (12), which the victim was over. Maybe the pepper on the scarf suggests that Bat (Sean Dingling) was involved, but he's in a coma. Wait, but how does this tie to Acro's testimony?

Wait, the key contradiction might be about the knowledge of the head's location. Acro says he couldn't look out the window to know where the head was, so he couldn't have aimed. But if there's evidence showing that the victim's head was positioned in a way that didn't require looking out the window, that would contradict. Alternatively, maybe the position of the wooden box and the footprints. The Crime Photo shows the footprints leading to where the victim is. If Acro left the bust from above, maybe the footprints could indicate where the head was. Wait, but the photo is just the scene, not sure.

Wait, looking at the testimony. Acro's testimony 4 says he couldn't know the location of the head, so he couldn't have dropped the bust. But the evidence might show that he didn't need to look out the window to know where the head was. Let's check the Circus Map (6). Acro is on the third floor of the lodging house. The Ringmaster's room is northeast. If the crime scene is the lodging house plaza, maybe the bust was dropped from above. But if Acro was on the third floor, maybe he could see directly down without looking out the window. Or perhaps the position of the window is such that he couldn't see, but there's another way.

Wait, looking at Evidence 15: Max G. Bust. It's a bronze statue taken from the cafeteria before the crime. If the bust was heavy, but Acro could lift it. Then, if he was on the third floor, maybe he dropped it from his room's window. But he claims he couldn't look out the window to see where the head was. However, maybe the victim's position was such that the head was under the window, so he didn't need to look. But the Crime Photo shows the victim lying on the box in the snow with footprints leading there. If the footprints were leading directly below Acro's window, then he could have known the position without looking. But the testimony says he couldn't look out the window, so how would he know the head's position? Unless the footprints show exactly where the head was, so he didn't need to look. Wait, but the photo's caption says there are footprints leading to where the victim is. So if Acro set up the meeting via the note (Evidence 16) in Regina's pocket, he could have directed the victim to a specific spot where he knew the victim would be. So even without looking out the window, he could have anticipated the victim's position. That would contradict his testimony that he couldn't know the head's location because he couldn't look out. The note (Evidence 16) says "Meet at 10:00 PM tonight at the lodging house plaza." If Acro placed the note, he knew the victim would be at that specific location, so he could have positioned the bust to drop exactly there without needing to look. Therefore, his testimony 4 (which claims he couldn't know the head's location) is contradicted by the note (Evidence 16), which he himself placed to lure the victim to a specific spot. Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 16 (the note) and Testimony 4 (Acro's claim he couldn't know the head's location because he couldn't look out the window). Because he set the meeting place, he knew where the victim would be, so he didn't need to look out the window to know the head's position. So the answer would be Evidence 16 and Testimony 4.

{"evidence": 16, "testimony": 4}
